alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 16 at 8:03PM EST until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rains have moved out of the area. Rainfall amounts up to 1 inch has occurred over this area during the last hour. This amount of rainfall will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 915 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Margate, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Hallandale, Miami Gardens, Lauderhill, Coconut Creek, North Miami Beach, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale and Aventura. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
